text: Abdul is a well-liked name among Arabic-speaking communities, typically given to boys. Its origin comes from two Arabic words: "abd," which translates to "servant" or "slave," and "al," which means "the." As a result, Abdul signifies "servant of the" followed by one of the 99 names of Allah, as per Islamic tradition. == People == * Abdulkarim, Servant of the most Generous * Abdurrahim, Servant of the Merciful * Abdurrahman, Servant of the Benevolent ==References== Category:Names
title: Abdul
